TaskManager Class Reference

This abstract class provides a ways for Systems to supply work to run asynchronously. Specifically, each ISystemTask uses a TaskManager to execute its Update method. Only one TaskManager should be created for a process. More...

Detailed Description

This abstract class provides a ways for Systems to supply work to run asynchronously. Specifically, each ISystemTask uses a TaskManager to execute its Update method. Only one TaskManager should be created for a process.

See also:
TaskManagerTP, TaskManagerTBB

Member Function Documentation

virtual void TaskManager::Init ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Call this from the primary thread before calling any other TaskManager methods.

Implemented in TaskManagerTBB, and TaskManagerTP.

virtual void TaskManager::Shutdown ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Call this from the primary thread as the last TaskManager call.

Implemented in TaskManagerTBB, and TaskManagerTP.

virtual void TaskManager::IssueJobsForSystemTasks ( ISystemTask **  pTasks,
u32  uCount,
f32  fDeltaTime 
) [pure virtual]

Call this from the primary thread to schedule system work.

Parameters:
pTasks an array of ISystemTask objects which should have their Update methods called asynchronously
uCount the size of the pTasks array
fDeltaTime amount of time to be passed to each system's Update method
See also:
TaskManager::WaitForSystemTasks, ISystemTask::Update

Implemented in TaskManagerTBB, and TaskManagerTP.

virtual void TaskManager::WaitForSystemTasks ( ISystemTask **  pTasks,
u32  uCount 
) [pure virtual]

Call this from the primary thread to wait until all tasks spawned with IssueJobsForSystemTasks and all of their subtasks are complete.

Parameters:
pTasks an array of ISystemTask objects
uCount the length of the pTasks array
See also:
TaskManager::IssueJobsForSystemTasks

Implemented in TaskManagerTBB, and TaskManagerTP.
